info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dillon, northeastern Darlington and central Marlboro Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clio, or 7 miles southeast of Bennettsville, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may fall in a short period of time resulting in brief localized flooding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes may become continuous during the peak of this storm. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Mccoll, Clio, Dunbar, Minturn, Society Hill, Blenheim and Tatum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
